intro: Clidemia penduliflora, commonly known as hangingflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, pendulous inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Clidemia penduliflora produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, attracting various pollinators.
